nodes.bodyText:
you should try to avoid browsing folder this way, you can do
dir(${env.LOCAL_DEPLOY_DIR}) {
    sh """
    zip -r kiegroup .
    curl --silent --upload-file kiegroup.zip -u ${kieUnpack} -v ${params.MAVEN_DEPLOY_REPOSITORY}/content-compressed
    """
}

I would suggest to replace 340-346 by
return repositoryScm ? params.PR_TARGET_BRANCH : 'master'
Same as comment in pipelines PR.

what happens here if no MAVEN_DEPLOY_REPOSITORY is given ?
Usually, if none mentioned, we are using the default one defined into the pom.xml.

I'm not sure how to go about deployment now. I tried just using the current mavenDeploy() with the parameter of the PR check repository, but this results in a 401 error when deploying to that repo.
This zip and curl method I was using previously uses the unpacks-zip-on-qa-nexus credential to authenticate itself to the repo, I'm not sure how to deploy to the default repo in the pom.xml in that case.
I could create 2 different branches of deployment depending on whether or not there is a MAVEN_DEPLOY_REPOSITORY parameter, but that seems kind of hacky. Also, would the unpacks-zip-on-qa-nexus credential even work universally for that?
How would you suggest I go about this?

I guess we would also need to retrieve the user/pwd from settings.xml to upload to usual maven as it is a different one...
or have different credentials with this information to do the curl. and so I would have the creds name as optional parameter of the pipeline (if empty get from settings.xml) and the main pipeline would send directly this information (here it would send unpacks-zip-on-qa-nexus for this use case).
wdyt ?

Using the zip and curl method if there are artifact repository and credentials parameters passed in requires using a withCredentials block, but authenticating with the retrieved credentials from settings.xml wouldn't. In this case, would it just be simpler to create two different branches depending on whether artifact repository and credentials parameters are passed in? That is, using a withCredentials block if there are and the current mavenDeploy() with no repository argument if there isn't. I initially thought this was not ideal, but it may be the simplest implementation after all?
yep you could have an if statement and have 2 different behaviors. I have no problem with that ;)
is that still used ? as far as I can see kiegroup/kogito-pipelines#46, you are checking before calling if the branch exist (which I prefer :))
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -35,10 +37,14 @@ pipeline {
         // Bot author information. Set as params for easy testing.
         string(name: 'GIT_AUTHOR_BOT', defaultValue: 'bsig-gh-bot', description: 'From which author should the PR be created ?')
         string(name: 'BOT_CREDENTIALS_ID', defaultValue: 'bsig-gh-bot', description: 'Credentials for PR creation')
+
+        // PR parameter to be filled out by GitHub Pull Request Builder for PR checks
+        string(name: 'PR_TARGET_BRANCH', defaultValue: '', description: 'What is the target branch of the PR? Will be automatically filled out by GitHub Pull Request Builder.')

nodes.bodyText: This is still needed because there are 2 repositories being checked out in runtimes. The original pipeline only checks if the branch exists for one of them (the one the PR is for). The other repository will need to fall back to checking out the target branch.
nodes.diffHunk:

         string(name: 'GIT_AUTHOR_BOT', defaultValue: 'bsig-gh-bot', description: 'From which author should the PR be created ?')

+        string(name: 'PR_TARGET_BRANCH', defaultValue: '', description: 'What is the target branch of the PR? Will be automatically filled out by GitHub Pull Request Builder.')

nodes.bodyText:
ah I see, you want to make use of the checkoutIfExist and the merge capability in there.
In that case, I think that would need to be added to each deploy pipeline (not only runtimes) => https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-pipelines/pull/46/files#r526653004
also, 2 small things:

can you change the comment on that param ? This is confusing as it is not automatic, the main pipeline is setting it
could you move that param to the Git information part ?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -35,10 +37,14 @@ pipeline {
         // Bot author information. Set as params for easy testing.
         string(name: 'GIT_AUTHOR_BOT', defaultValue: 'bsig-gh-bot', description: 'From which author should the PR be created ?')

+        string(name: 'PR_TARGET_BRANCH', defaultValue: '', description: 'What is the target branch of the PR? Will be automatically filled out by GitHub Pull Request Builder.')

nodes.bodyText: I guess that one could then be deleted
This should not be deleted because in case of MAVEN_DEPLOY_CREDS_ID not defined we may still need to deploy to MAVEN_DEPLOY_REPOSITORY
when do you need to set another directory ?
We don't need to. I'll remove it from the other repositories as well.
